algorithm_technique: Two pointers: one from the start, one from the end, to identify and remove matching prefix and suffix characters.
problem_summary_simple: Remove matching prefix and suffix characters of the same type until no more removals are possible.
problem_summary_technical: Use two pointers, `left` and `right`. While `s[left] == s[right]`, advance `left` past all occurrences of `s[left]` and decrement `right` past all occurrences of `s[right]`.
key_insights: The operation can be performed greedily from both ends simultaneously.
The key is to advance the pointers past all consecutive identical characters at each step.
The process stops when the pointers meet or cross, or when the characters at the pointers differ.
